adminConnectivityTab.baseUrlMismatch: This might be intentional if e.g. you cloned your instance. Please adjust the url below.
adminConnectivityTab.baseUrlMismatchBanner: Your {{atlassianProduct}} url does not match the configured one below
adminConnectivityTab.confluenceUrlHelpText: This is the publicly reachable URL of your {{atlassianProduct}} instance
adminConnectivityTab.connectDescription: During the installation of the app, we tried to register the instance with our cloud infrastructure, which unfortunately failed. Please make sure that the {{atlassianProduct}} instance can reach yasoon services and Microsoft 365.
adminConnectivityTab.connectedDescription: We were able to successfully establish a secure connection to the yasoon services. If you experience unexpected connectivity issues you can perform a connectivity check below.
adminConnectivityTab.connectivityHelpText: Please enter the URL under which your {{atlassianProduct}} system is reachable from the internet. If you change the existing public URL of your system, all users will be logged out of the current instance.
adminConnectivityTab.noBaseUrlInSettings: Connection to yasoon not possible. Please connect the public reachable {{atlassianProduct}} url. Then, do a connectivity-check afterwards to see if everything works as intended
adminConnectivityTab.registerInstanceErrorTitle: Error trying to reach yasoon backend. See connectivity check
adminConnectivityTab.staticIPHelpText: If you need to allow IPs in your firewall, please check out our {link1}
adminConnectivityTab.staticIPHelpText2: To use the app, your {{atlassianProduct}} system needs to be reachable by our servers. If your system is behind a firewall, you can allow access for the following IPs - all requests will come from these IPs.
adminConnectivityTab.yasoonConnectivityDescription: As the app deeply integrates with Microsoft 365, which is a cloud only solution, our app behaves a bit differently than “classic” {{atlassianProduct}} Server apps. Your {{atlassianProduct}} instance needs to connect to yasoon services as well as to Microsoft 365. {link1}

adminFeaturesOverviewConfluence.addCalendarsWithTemplatesText: Add calendars by selecting from the calendar templates available in our (new) edit screen. Every single calendar template provides default settings to make it easier for you to start working with your calendars in Confluence.
adminFeaturesOverviewConfluence.layoutOptionsText: Change the calendar layout depending on the calendar dates you share. Jira dates might better be displayed in a timeline view (e.g. Jira releases or sprints) while shared Outlook dates will better be shown in a calendar view (e.g. holidays or user calendar’s).
adminFeaturesOverviewConfluence.managePermissionsText: This goes for both Outlook calendar and Jira dates! Manage calendar permissions easily yourself. Choose who can see or edit calendars in Confluence. Decide if everyone with access to the Confluence space or page can view the data shared or if it should only be those with a Microsoft 365 or Jira Log-in.
adminFeaturesOverviewConfluence.pageCalendarHeading: Add Outlook calendars to Confluence pages or spaces
adminFeaturesOverviewConfluence.pageCalendarText: Use Outlook calendars as a fast, powerful, and secure way to work with calendars in Confluence. Benefit from real-time data from Microsoft 365, no sync is needed. Add new project meetings directly in Confluence.
adminFeaturesOverviewConfluence.scheduleMeetingsText: Schedule Outlook and Microsoft Teams meetings directly in Confluence. Even decide on whose behalf you’d like to schedule the meeting. View meeting details with a single click after sending out the invite.

adminGlobalMailboxesTab.description: Add pre-existing shared mailboxes to make them available for the "Global calendars" template. This is a legacy feature - we recommend using Outlook Group calendars or Microsoft Teams channel calendars going forward.
adminGlobalMailboxesTab.emptyStateDescription: You don't have any shared mailboxes configured yet.
adminGlobalMailboxesTab.heading: Shared mailboxes

adminHelpTab.contactDescription: In case you need technical help or just want to learn about our product, we are happy to help!
adminHelpTab.documentationDescription: It's always a good idea to check out our documentation first, we try to answer common questions there. Use the quick links below to get started!
adminHelpTab.supportToolsDescription: Additional configurations, please only use in consultation with the support team.

adminOverviewTab.connectivityErrorFlagDescription: Please check to connectivity tab for further information. The calendar won't work as intended right now.
adminOverviewTab.exchangeConnectionErrorFlagDescription: We detected, that you had selected Exchange as your connection method in the previous version. This version of {{yasoonProduct}} does not work with Microsoft Exchange. Only Microsoft 365 is supported. If you want to use Exchange, you need to install v1 again.
adminOverviewTab.gettingStartedFlagDescription: Welcome to {{yasoonProduct}}. Go to any page and insert the calendar macro to get started!
adminOverviewTab.migrationErrorFlagDescription: Please check the migration tab for further information. The calendar won't work as intended right now.
adminOverviewTab.migrationGuideText: If you are migrating from Atlassian Team Calendars, there is an easy way to take over calendar events to your Outlook calendar. Check our migration guide for more details.

adminScreen.heading: {{yasoonProduct}}
adminScreen.inValidLicenseText: You don't have a valid license or it has expired. If you'd like to continue using our app, please get a valid license!

adminServerMigrationTab.macroMigrationErrorsHeading: Not all pages could be migrated! See the errors to identify what to do
adminServerMigrationTab.migrationNotPossible: Migration not possible right now. Check the connectivity tab first
adminServerMigrationTab.migrationRequiredDescription: When you are ready to migrate the settings, hit the button down below. Depending on your instance size and the usage of the calendar, this can take up several minutes!
adminServerMigrationTab.migrationRunningDescription: The migration is running, do not close this browser window/tab until it is finished

adminSharingTab.anonymousSharingDescription: By default shared calendars can’t be accessed by anonymous users. If you want to allow calendars to be shared on public pages you explicitly need to enable this setting.
adminSharingTab.anonymousSharingToggleLabel: Allow users to publicly share data
adminSharingTab.heading: Calendar sharing settings
adminSharingTab.sharingDescription: This feature allows your users to share calendars with other users. Everyone will see the calendar the same way as the person that created it. Notice: if you change this setting later on, already shared calendars will still be shared!

adminSupportScreen.description: This are support features, please only use in consultation with the support team.

agendaViewSetting.heading: Calendar view scope
agendaViewSetting.subHeading: How many days should be visible in the calendar

calendarList.filteringCategoriesOnlyLabel: This calendar has been filtered events with categories {{categories}}.

calendarList.filteringShowAsOnlyLabel: This calendar has been filtered for {{freeBusyStatus}} events.
calendarList.noFilterLabel: The calendar has no filter criteria.
calendarList.reauthenticateMessage: Your browser has restrictive privacy settings, so you need to re-authenticate every 24 hours.
calendarList.userCantFetchCalendarMessage: You are not able to load events from this calendar due to technical limitations. Please contact the calendar owner to add it with "Shared Permissions".

calendarListScreen.noCalendarSelectedMessage: It seems that something went wrong. Please select a calendar on the left side

connectivitySettingsTab.connectivityCheckDescription: Support tool to check and troubleshooting the connection to mandatory services. Only for analysis and won’t change any configuration.
connectivitySettingsTab.heading: Connection settings overview
connectivitySettingsTab.introductionText: Your data center/server environment needs to reach and also needs to be reachable from our servers. On this page, you can check, if your system does fulfill all our requirements to work properly.

generalSettingsTab.heading: General Settings
generalSettingsTab.spaceEditSettingDescription: By default, space calendar settings can only be edited by space administrators. You can allow all users with space view permissions to change the space calendar here.
generalSettingsTab.spaceEditSettingLabel: Allow non space admins to edit the space calendar

editingOnDraftBlocked.mainDescriptionText:
Sorry for the inconvenience. 
Editing the calendar on draft pages is not possible with this version of Confluence. 
Save the page first, then you can edit the calendar.

editongOnBlueprintBlocked.mainDescriptionText:
Sorry for the inconvenience. 
Editing the calendar on blueprints is not possible due to technically limitations.

secretRotation.description: The app stores a shared secret to ensure a secure connection with our services. All {{atlassianProduct}} admins may have access to this secret. To avoid any malicious and unauthorized data access, we recommend to rotate the secret whenever you remove an admin from your instance
secretRotation.heading: Secret rotation

sidbarEmptyState.missingProjectPermissionEmptyStateText: You don't have the permission to add calendars. Only {{atlassianProduct}} project admins are allowed to edit.
